intro: Salvia prattii var. souliei, commonly known as the Chinese sage, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant produces showy violet to blue flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is often cultivated for its medicinal properties and as a hardy garden plant.
